Name: Statuette of Amun
Description: A bronze statuette of Amun, primeval god, reflection of the supreme god, "the hidden one", venerated mainly in Thebes, where he formed a triad together with Mut and Khonsu. He is shown  standing up, with the left leg and arm moved forward, originally holding a scepter now missing. The two feathers of the crown he is wearing are also missing. He is wearing a short skirt (shendit) and a false beard.
